why.details: Seeks financial gain by stealing valuable company IP.

how.description: Requests higher permissions via email to admins.
how.procedure: Insider leverages or fabricates a trusted relationship (or uses valid credentials) to obtain elevated permissions from administrators via email request.
observable_evidence: Unusual permission-request emails outside normal workflow
Grant of admin privileges in system logs without justified reason
Access granted outside normal change-control process
how.impact: Adversary obtains elevated access enabling access to high-value IP and systems.

how.description: Solicits colleagues to gain access to key data and systems.
how.procedure: Insider uses social engineering to trick colleagues or administrators into delegating access or installing/configuring permissions, thereby gaining elevated privileges.
observable_evidence: Emails or messages soliciting credential sharing or access delegation
Requests for account elevation or role change outside standard process
Temporary sessions with elevated rights on systems
how.impact: Elevated privileges allow lateral movement or deeper access to IP/data stores.

how.description: Accesses sensitive project files and system credentials, then copies data for exfiltration.
how.procedure: Insider with escalated rights downloads or copies intellectual-property files and system credentials, transfers to removable or external media/cloud, and prepares for later removal.
observable_evidence: Large volume of file read/copy operations by an elevated account
Use of removable media or external cloud folder access by insider account
Off-hours file access or unusual destination addresses
how.impact: Loss of intellectual property, financial or competitive damage to organization.
